text.p: - The European parliament is expected to ratify Slovenia's association agreement with the European Union, signed on June 10, at its session in Strasbourg today.
- Minister of Education Slavko Gaber officially opened a primary school in Sarajevo. The school was reconstructed with the aid of Slovenia's government.

- Troubled bus and truck maker TAM, based in Maribor, will have to be liquidated after a deal with Saudi Arabia on the sale of 500 buses failed. TAM's management on Monday accused the government of non-cooperation.
- Negotiations between employers and unions will continue on Tuesday in a drive to reach an agreement over work benefits before a scheduled two-hour general strike on Thursday.
- Unemployment in August rose to 13.5 percent, up 2.4 percent from a year ago, SLovenia's Statistical Office said.
- Share of agriculture in Slovenia's 1995 gross domestic product was 4.3 percent down from a total of 4.9 percent in 1992, Agriculture Minister Joze Osterc said.
- The reconstructed department of hematology at Ljubljana's clinical centre was reopened on Monday. The modernized department will enable up to 25 transplantations of bone marrow per year.
